I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
P: stack nat
B: list (list nat * list nat)
C: stack nat

Goal:
B <<= gamma1 C -> exists A : list (card nat), A <<= C /\ gamma1 A = B

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
card = fun X : Type => (list X * list X)%type : Type -> Type Arguments card _%type_scope
gamma1 = fun A : stack nat => map (fun '(x, y) => (x, x ++ [#] ++ y ++ [#])) A : stack nat -> list (list nat * list nat)
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
incl_app_left : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> A <<= C /\ B <<= C
itau1_app : forall A B0 : list nat, itau1 ?P (A ++ B0) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B0 where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- stack ?X]
itau2_app : forall A B0 : list nat, itau2 ?P (A ++ B0) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B0 where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- stack ?X]
Facts.app_incl_l : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> A <<= C
app_incl_l : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> A <<= C
app_incl_R : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> B <<= C
Facts.app_incl_R : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> B <<= C
EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_prod : forall (f1 : nat -> option ?X) (f2 : nat -> option ?Y), EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' ?X f1 -> EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' ?Y f2 -> EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' (?X * ?Y) (EnumerabilityFacts.prod_enum f1 f2) where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type] ?Y : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_list : forall L : nat -> list ?X, ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' ?X L -> ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' (list ?X) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_list L) where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type]
tau2_app : forall A B0 : stack ?X, tau2 (A ++ B0) = tau2 A ++ tau2 B0 where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type]
tau1_app : forall A B0 : stack ?X, tau1 (A ++ B0) = tau1 A ++ tau1 B0 where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type]
PCPX = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists A : list (card X), A <<= P /\ A <> [] /\ tau1 A = tau2 A : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments PCPX {X}%type_scope
der_sing : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 x y where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type]
incl_lcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= B < -> x el B /\ A <<= B
der_cons : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u v : string ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 u v -> derivable P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v) where ?X : [P : stack nat B : list (list nat * list nat) C : stack nat |- Type]
tau2_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau2 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, (y, a :: x) el B
tau1_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau1 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, (a :: x, y) el B
split : forall A B : Type, list (A * B) -> list A * list B
combine : forall A B : Type, list A -> list B -> list (A * B)

Facts.cons_incl : forall (X : Type) (a : X) (A B : list X), a :: A <<= B -> A <<= B
incl_rcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
filter_mono : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> bool) (A B : list X), A <<= B -> filter p A <<= filter p B

```coq
intros H.
destruct H as [A H1 H2].
exists (map (fun '(x, y) => (x, x ++ [#] ++ y ++ [#])) A).
split.
- apply incl_map; auto.
- rewrite <- H2; auto.
Qed.```
